newsitem.title: CANADA: M.L. Cass in Kazakhstan/Ivory Coast oil buy.
newsitem.headline: M.L. Cass in Kazakhstan/Ivory Coast oil buy.

text.p: Canada's M.L. Cass Petroleum Corp said on Tuesday it signed a letter of intent with Triton-Vuko Energy Group Ltd to buy and develop the Karazhanbas onshore and offshore oil field in Kazakhstan and one third of the Espoir offshore oil field in Ivory Coast.

M.L. Cass said it would carry Triton-Vuko for a 10-percent interest before payout and convert that stake to a 40-percent working interest after it recovered 130 percent of capital expenditure on the properties.
Under the deal, the company will operate and own 100 percent of the Kazakhstan field and 33 percent of the Ivory Coast field, it said.

M.L Cass said it would acquire daily production of 15,000 barrels of oil and one billion barrels of reserves, consisting of 650 million barrels of proven developed reserves and 350 million barrels of proven undeveloped reserves.

The company plans to raise US$25 million before the end of the year to begin further development of the fields and another US$100 million in the first quarter of 1997. The financings will be subject to shareholder approval, it said. -- Reuters Calgary Bureau 403 531-1624
